page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY,and GENERAL
page.content: { Yarpole}is in a hollow of gently undulating land beneath{Croft Ambrey } (950ft) and{Bircher Common}(900ft). There is mixed farming on the lower land,the soil is medium loam,smaller hedged fields survive,crop rotation is practiced. Most of the high land round {Croft}Castle is dense deciduous wood- land, this and the mostly open common land is owned by the{National Trust.} The{Ambrey,}from which 13 counties can be seen,was in 550 B.C. a fortified camp where once about 600 people lived Below this a small stream descends through a series of large fishpools in the woods to{Yarpole}where it was once dammed for the{Saxon}mill, the form of the{Saxon}village remains.The 11c gate -house has been used as a bakery, the {Belfry}is 13c and part of a barn at {Church Farm}is believed Saxon.
